Chessboard.pieces

Class SuperPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • Chessboard.pieces.Piece
      • Chessboard.pieces.SuperPiece
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class SuperPiece
extends Piece
    This class is used to create protecting or attacking patterns from a chessboard square. It is used at Evaluate-class to determine, whether own piece is protecting player's another piece or whether enemy's piece is attacking player's piece. This should not be used in the game as an actual piece.

    • Method Detail

      • getProtectionStatus

        public boolean getProtectionStatus(Chessboard chessboard,
                                   boolean own)
        Determines, if a piece positioned at superpiece's position is protected or attacked.
        Parameters:
        chessboard - Chessboard-object, where the game is played.
        own - Boolean, whether the positions to be checked should be protecting or attacking.
        Returns:
        boolean, true = protected/attacked, false otherwise.
